title: Task 71

answers.feedback: Identity verification is more about proving your identity, not personal preferences.
Identity verification doesn't necessarily involve checking financial status.
Identity verification is broader than just verifying an email address.

answers.answer: Making sure you are who you say you are

description: Identity verification is like proving who you are. It's a way of confirming that the person using a system or service is really the person they claim to be. This can involve showing an ID card, using a password, or, using biometrics like facial recognition or fingerprints.
